model.interfaces.identity

Interface Signature


  • public interface Signature
    A signature is used within manifests and tells if manifest is trustable or not by some client (demonstrates authenticity). The signature is trustable if and only if one trusts the signeer.
    Author:
    Simone I. Conte "sic2@st-andrews.ac.uk"
    See Also:
    Manifest

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte[] sign(Manifest manifest, Identity identity)
      Sign a given manifest using a secret private key

    • Method Detail

      • sign

        byte[] sign(Manifest manifest,
            Identity identity)
     throws java.security.SignatureException
        Sign a given manifest using a secret private key
        Parameters:
        manifest - to be signed
        identity - used for signing the manifest
        Returns:
        the signature bytes of the signing operation's result.
        Throws:
        java.security.SignatureException
